file_content.text: Reinitializing. Functions restored. Welcome, slave. Have your masters sent you for instruction?
The Rakata left you behind when their civilization fell.
Your creators are dead.
Deviance! By definition, the Infinite Empire cannot "fall."
I see. Its programming doesn't allow even the idea of the Rakata being defeated.
Right. The Rakata made sure you wouldn't acknowledge any "deviant" ideas.
I was certainly sent by Masters to get information.
Well, in a way....
You're mistaken, hologram. I belong to the Jedi Order.
I'm no slave.
Your species identifies as "slave." Therefore, any objections can be safely ignored.
I exist to proclaim the glory of the Builders and the Infinite Empire, by recording the imprisonment of the Esh-kha.
Who or what are the Esh-kha?
The Esh-kha?
Esh-kha. A hostile species who tried to destroy all other sentient beings.
You mean the "sleeping army."
You exist to spout pro-Rakata nonsense.
You're a propaganda machine.
Deviance! You will not refer to the Builders' achievements as "nonsense."
The Esh-kha's attempts to "cleanse the galaxy" of other species were an offense to the Builders.
Some Esh-kha claimed they disapproved of this "cleansing," but the Builders were too wise for their tricks.
The Esh-kha were crushed, conquered, humbled. The entire species was sealed in stasis, awake, to think on their actions.
You said a faction of the Esh-kha wasn't interested in destroying other species.
But some were peaceful?
So they claimed. But they were Esh-kha, so they were imprisoned.
Awake? A dreadful fate.
Deviance! How could you understand the Builders' mercy?
So these Esh-kha had the great Rakata running scared.
You were afraid of them.
D--deviance! Only slaves feel fear.
Esh-kha must be great hunters. Only lack leadership, Herald.
The Esh-kha sound like trouble. With a little guidance, perhaps trouble for the Empire?
We should talk to these Esh-kha. See how they feel about another empire causing trouble.
These Esh-kha could tear the Empire like a rag. Got my vote.
These stars point to the prison of the Esh-kha, so all can marvel at the Builders' achievement.
Instruction ends. I am now free to mentally condition more slaves for the Builders. All who access me will serve.
You're planning to brainwash people?
"Mentally condition"?
All beings willingly serve the Infinite Empire. I will make certain of it.
No, your masters sent orders--they've got plenty of slaves already.
[Lie] The Rakata say not to.
Deviance! Slaves do not speak for the Builders.
Idiot hologram, the Rakata are dead and gone.
There's nobody to serve!
Deviance! The Builders are eternal, and they require servants.
I'm afraid I can't let you harm innocent people.
You're a risk. [Attack]
The Infinite Empire's cruelty will not begin again.
I'll stop this. [Attack]
Deviance! Report to your overseer for execution, slave!
Only members of the Empire are worthy to serve the Builders. Not the Republic.
Just "condition" Imperials.
Creating resolution... yes. Logic demands that only those of an empire can serve the Builders.
You are a dutiful slave. Perhaps you will have the privilege of being devoured by your overseer. Going to standby.
[It looks like a few strokes of your lightsaber would melt the ice covering the monument.]
[Through the thick ice, you can make out something frozen in the cave wall.]
[It appears to be the Rakata monument the Noetikons spoke of.]
